repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - Land Reform and Poverty
            Alleviation Pilot Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Project outcome is rated satisfactory,
            with project sustainability likely. The overall performance
            of both the World Bank and the Borrower are rated
            satisfactory. Evaluation and supervision have produced the
            following lessons: (1) The market-based mechanism,
            community-led, is an agile and effective complementary
            method for settling landless rural families, condensing on
            average, the entire process from identification to purchase
            into about 90 days. (2) Self-selection for participation
            effectively pinpoints the rural poor and in particular, the
            "entrepreneurial poor", those more likely to
            settle and produce successfully. The vast majority of
            beneficiaries have had household incomes/characteristics
            consistent with the targeted group. (3) Most properties
            acquired are modestly-sized relative to traditional land
            reform projects, settling some 15-30 families. Associations
            with less tha

repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - Land Reform and Poverty
            Alleviation Pilot Project : Eligibility Report

abstracts.cdata!:
The Eligibility Report for the Land
            Reform and Poverty Alleviation Pilot Project in Brazil
            responds to the second Request for Inspection (the "
            new Request"). This is the second Request submitted for
            the same project. The new Response reiterates the points
            already made in the Response to the first Request for
            Inspection, stressing that this project is considered well
            designed. Management denies that project funds are being
            used to purchase unsuitable farmlands, although it
            recognizes that, because it operates in the poorest regions
            of Brazil, the project may include areas with "use
            restrictions." Management also dismisses any
            allegations that the affected communities are paying
            inflated prices for the farms. Despite claims, The
            Requesters did not provide the Panel with any other evidence
            that they had sought to discuss their concerns with
            Management between the first and the second Requests.  The
            Panel is not satisfied that the Requesters meet all of the
            eligibility requirements and determine that the Request is
            not eligible for Inspection.

repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - Land Reform and Poverty
            Alleviation Pilot Project (request 1) : Report and
            Recommendation on the Request for Inspection

abstracts.cdata!:
The Report and Recommendation on the
            Inspection Panel for the Brazil Land Reform and Poverty
            Alleviation Pilot Project examines the request made by
            groups that felt Bank policies and procedures had been
            violated in regard to this project.  The Request claims that
            the Requestors are being or may likely be materially and
            adversely affected by the design and execution of the
            project financed by the Bank loan and that they are likely
            to be similarly affected by follow-up loans, which the Bank
            intends to make to support such kind of projects in Brazil.
            The Management responds that the project is a pilot program
            and is being supervised very closely and it is a
            well-designed operation. The Report states that the claims
            made by the Requestors are unsubstantiated and the Request
            does not meet the requirements for Registration or Investigation.
